page.title: 06Housing in Alresford.
page.content: The traditional village of Alresford used to be centred around the creek and the 18th century hall, but the development of an estate meant that there was a complete change of com- munity centre. The estate was built on heath land which was worthless agri- culturally but the large incoming pop- ulation soon created its own problems. The estate completely changed the nature of the village from a sleepy curve in the river consisting of a few farms and farm workers into a thriving busy village, popular for both perman- ent residence and weekend activities. In Alresford a total population of 2300 people live in 800 houses and it has now been decided that there is to be no further development. However, there is still a huge demand for homes within the village, especially in the Â£25-35000 range. There are no flats.
